data.Name: 2-Dimensional Pattern Matching
data.Description: Lossy data compression (a general category of methods) eliminates data perceived to be less important or relevant in favor of reducing file size.  Lossy compressions cannot be reversed.
data.Source: Workbook curated by PPDM; commit SHA - No SHA (Workbook not committed).

data.Name: 7z
data.Description: Java compression archive
data.Source: Workbook curated by PPDM; commit SHA - No SHA (Workbook not committed).

data.Name: Advanced Video Coding
data.Description: A wavelet transform where the discrete-time (sampled) signal is passed through more filters than the discrete wavelet transform (DWT).
data.Source: Workbook curated by PPDM; commit SHA - No SHA (Workbook not committed).

data.Name: Analogous Time-domain
data.Description: Various compression methods employing artifical neural networks (machine learning) applied to layers.
data.Source: Workbook curated by PPDM; commit SHA - No SHA (Workbook not committed).

data.Name: ARC
data.Description: Archive format that supports lossless data compression
data.Source: Workbook curated by PPDM; commit SHA - No SHA (Workbook not committed).

data.Name: Bit Resolution Compression
data.Description: In digital audio using pulse-code modulation (PCM), bit depth is the number of bits of information in each sample, and it directly corresponds to the resolution of each sample.
data.Source: Workbook curated by PPDM; commit SHA - No SHA (Workbook not committed).

data.Name: Bit Resolution Compression.16-bit
data.Description: In digital audio using pulse-code modulation (PCM), bit depth is the number of bits of information in each sample, and it directly corresponds to the resolution of each sample.
data.Source: Workbook curated by PPDM; commit SHA - No SHA (Workbook not committed).

data.Name: Bit Resolution Compression.32-bit Floating Point
data.Description: Dictionary learning has shown to provide representations with high level of sparsity. It stores the shape of the redundant events once, and represents each occurrence of these events with a single sparse coefficient.
data.Source: Workbook curated by PPDM; commit SHA - No SHA (Workbook not committed).

data.Name: Bit Resolution Compression.32-bit Integer
data.Description: In digital audio using pulse-code modulation (PCM), bit depth is the number of bits of information in each sample, and it directly corresponds to the resolution of each sample.
data.Source: Workbook curated by PPDM; commit SHA - No SHA (Workbook not committed).

data.Name: Bit Resolution Compression.8-bit
data.Description: In digital audio using pulse-code modulation (PCM), bit depth is the number of bits of information in each sample, and it directly corresponds to the resolution of each sample.
data.Source: Workbook curated by PPDM; commit SHA - No SHA (Workbook not committed).

data.Name: Bit Resolution Compression.8-bit Floating Point
data.Description: In digital audio using pulse-code modulation (PCM), bit depth is the number of bits of information in each sample, and it directly corresponds to the resolution of each sample.
data.Source: Workbook curated by PPDM; commit SHA - No SHA (Workbook not committed).

data.Name: Burrows–Wheeler Transform
data.Description: LZ77 and LZ78 are the two lossless data compression algorithms published in papers by Abraham Lempel and Jacob Ziv in 1977[1] and 1978...They are both theoretically dictionary coders.
data.Source: Workbook curated by PPDM; commit SHA - No SHA (Workbook not committed).

data.Name: Byte-Pair Encoding
data.Source: Workbook curated by PPDM; commit SHA - No SHA (Workbook not committed).

data.Name: Data Differencing
data.Description: ARC is a lossless data compression and archival format. The file format and the program were both called ARC.
data.Source: Workbook curated by PPDM; commit SHA - No SHA (Workbook not committed).

data.Name: Deep Neural Networks
data.Description: LPC is a method used mostly in audio signal processing and speech processing for representing the spectral envelope of a digital signal of speech in compressed form, using the information of a linear predictive model.
data.Source: Workbook curated by PPDM; commit SHA - No SHA (Workbook not committed).

data.Name: Dictionary Learning
data.Description: A lossy data compression framework based on an approximate two-dimensional (2D) pattern matching (2D-PMC) extension of the Lempel-Ziv (1977, 1978) lossless scheme.
data.Source: Workbook curated by PPDM; commit SHA - No SHA (Workbook not committed).

data.Name: Discrete Cosine Transform
data.Description: A data differencing algorithm takes as input source data and target data, and produces difference data such that given the source data and the difference data, one can reconstruct the target data
data.Source: Workbook curated by PPDM; commit SHA - No SHA (Workbook not committed).

data.Name: GZip
data.Description: Compression and decompression file format
data.Source: Workbook curated by PPDM; commit SHA - No SHA (Workbook not committed).

data.Name: Jar
data.Description: A simple form of data compression in which the most common pair of consecutive bytes of data is replaced with a byte that does not occur within that data.
data.Source: Workbook curated by PPDM; commit SHA - No SHA (Workbook not committed).

data.Name: Lempel-Ziv
data.Description: A dictionary coder, LZ77 maintains a sliding window during compression.
data.Source: Workbook curated by PPDM; commit SHA - No SHA (Workbook not committed).

data.Name: Linear Predictive Coding
data.Description: SBC is any form of transform coding that breaks a signal into a number of different frequency bands, typically by using a fast Fourier transform, and encodes each one independently. This decomposition is often the first step in data compression for audio and video signals.
data.Source: Workbook curated by PPDM; commit SHA - No SHA (Workbook not committed).

data.Name: Lossless
data.Description: BWT rearranges a character string into runs of similar characters. The process is reversible.
data.Source: Workbook curated by PPDM; commit SHA - No SHA (Workbook not committed).

data.Name: Lossy
data.Description: Lossless data compression algorithms use statistical data redundancy to represent data without losing any information, so that the process is reversible.
data.Source: Workbook curated by PPDM; commit SHA - No SHA (Workbook not committed).

data.Name: LZ77
data.Description: Conceptually, LZ78 decompression could allow random access to the input if the entire dictionary were known in advance. However, in practice the dictionary is created during encoding and decoding by creating a new phrase whenever a token is output
data.Source: Workbook curated by PPDM; commit SHA - No SHA (Workbook not committed).

data.Name: LZ78
data.Description: DCT expresses a finite sequence of data points in terms of a sum of cosine functions oscillating at different frequencies. The DCT, first proposed by Nasir Ahmed in 1972, is a widely used transformation technique in signal processing and data compression
data.Source: Workbook curated by PPDM; commit SHA - No SHA (Workbook not committed).

data.Name: Sub-band Coding
data.Description: In digital audio using pulse-code modulation (PCM), bit depth is the number of bits of information in each sample, and it directly corresponds to the resolution of each sample.
data.Source: Workbook curated by PPDM; commit SHA - No SHA (Workbook not committed).

data.Name: Walsh Transform
data.Description: Compression of the signal in the time domain
data.Source: Workbook curated by PPDM; commit SHA - No SHA (Workbook not committed).

data.Name: Wavelet Packet
data.Description: A class of Fourier transforms.
data.Source: Workbook curated by PPDM; commit SHA - No SHA (Workbook not committed).

data.Name: Zip
data.Description: Compression and decompression file format
data.Source: Workbook curated by PPDM; commit SHA - No SHA (Workbook not committed).
